title: Rewrite Not Working With Back-end's Self Signed Certificate
body:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://github.com/ankitkmrpatel/nextjs-.net-template

### To Reproduce

1. Run the Front-end.
2. Run the Back-end.
3. Check the Home Page in UI.

`master` branch has rewrite URL code while in `feature` branch we are using the full URL to call the back-end.

### Current vs. Expected behavior

Following the steps from Running the app section, I expected UI to call the API using rewrite URL, however, I encountered the self signed error, 

`
Failed to proxy https://localhost:7248/weatherforecast [Error: self-signed certificate] { code: 'DEPTH_ZERO_SELF_SIGNED_CERT' }
[Error: self-signed certificate] { code: 'DEPTH_ZERO_SELF_SIGNED_CERT' }
`

when using the full URL to call the API, the API and UI works fine.

### Provide environment information

```bash
Operating System:
  Platform: win32
  Arch: x64
  Version: Windows 11 Home Single Language
  Available memory (MB): 15655
  Available CPU cores: 16
Binaries:
  Node: 20.15.1
  npm: 10.9.2
  Yarn: N/A
  pnpm: 9.12.3
Relevant Packages:
  next: 15.3.4 // Latest available version is detected (15.3.4).
  eslint-config-next: 15.3.1
  react: 19.1.0
  react-dom: 19.1.0
  typescript: 5.8.3
Next.js Config:
  output: N/A
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Not sure

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

next dev (local)

### Additional context

_No response_
